workflowInfo.workflowDefaultName: POR of a CPC with a CF
workflowInfo.workflowDescription: Use when a CF’s CPC is to be POR’d and there are NO physical or logical changes to the CF

step.name: Step1
step.title: How to use this workflow
step.description:
To use this workflow, note the following:
Take ownership! Make sure that you have ownership of workflow steps that you want to perform, and assign other steps to the appropriate users, using the Assignment and Ownership action in the Workflow Steps table. Taking ownership is important, because without it you will not see the Perform tab, which contains the meat of the instructions for each step, instructions you'll need to complete the workflow task..
If you're the owner of the workflow, you can take ownership of all steps. If you were assigned some or all steps by the owner, you can take ownership of those steps.
Do the following:
From the table listing the steps for the workflow (the Workflow Steps table), select the step or steps to be owned by you. This action is disabled if the step is not assigned to you.
Click Actions, then select Assignment and Ownership --> Take Ownership. The Take Ownership window is displayed. This page includes the Selected Steps table. You can expand this section to review the steps for which this action applies.
Optionally, enter a comment in the Comments field to document this action.
Click OK to complete the transfer of step ownership to yourself.
Did these instructions work? To verify that these instructions worked, check to see if the Perform tab is not grayed out, and that when you click on it, you see information in the Perform tab.
Expand all steps for ease of navigation: You might find it easier to navigate through all the steps in the workflow if you expand the view so that all the sub-steps show as follows:
Click Actions, then select Select All.
Click Actions, then select Expand.
Track your progress: When you have performed the work of a step, click the Finish box below the instructions to track your progress through the workflow. This also takes you back out to the list of steps for the workflow so that you are ready to go on to the next one.
Navigate substeps: To navigate to the substeps contained within a step, click on the workflow title of the workflow at the top of the screen. Although the sub-steps are listed below the step, you cannot navigate to the sub-steps from within a step.
Note that a step containing substeps does not include a Perform tab.
step.instructions: Congratulations! If you can read this, you have successfully taken ownership of this workflow step!

step.name: Step2
step.title: When to use this workflow
step.description:
Use the procedure in this workflow when the CPC on which the coupling facility resides is going to be PORd and there are no physical or logical changes to the CF.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.

instructions.p: See POR of a CPC with a Coupling Facility with no Physical or Logical Changes to the CF (https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSLTBW_2.3.0/com.ibm.zos.v2r3.ieaf100/nophys.htm).

step.name: Step3
step.title: Create new CFRM policy
step.description:
Create a new CFRM policy distinct from the currently active policy with the new CF definition and updated structure definitions based on the CFSIZER or SIZER web-based utility.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Create a new CFRM policy distinct from the currently active policy distinct from the currently active policy. You can create a new CFRM policy ahead of time to minimize net down time. Appropriate structure sizes for the new CFCC level can be obtained from either:
CFSizer at http://www-947.ibm.com/systems/support/z/cfsizer/
Sizer at http://www-947.ibm.com/systems/support/z/cfsizer/altsize.html.
Updated structure sizes are necessary to ensure that a performance problem does not occur due to a structure space constraint. Also, the updated structure sizes will ensure that there is no issue restarting an application in the future due to invalid structure sizes.
This step is required for CFCC Level changes. This step is desirable if the sizes were not adjusted across the last CFCC Level upgrade or if the usage of the structures has changed significantly.
Alternatively, update the current policy "in place" to avoid changing the name of the policy. For information on defining a CFRM policy, see CFRM parameters for administrative data utility (https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSLTBW_2.2.0/com.ibm.zos.v2r2.ieaf100/subcfrm.htm).
Caution: This procedure assumes that the CF links, control unit, and CFRM definition are not changing. If the links, control unit, or CFRM definition change, the CF may become accessible earlier than planned.
Note that if all systems reside on the same CPC then the new CFRM policy must be started before the last system is shutdown.

step.name: Step4
step.title: Quiesce work on z/OS images on the CPC and remove the images from the sysplex
step.description:
Quiesce work on z/OS images that reside on the CPC being PORd or removed and remove the images from the sysplex.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.

ol.li: Quiesce all work on z/OS images that reside on the CPC being PORd or removed

Remove z/OS images from the sysplex by issuing the following command:
V XCF,sysname,OFFLINE

step.name: Step5
step.title: Ensure CTN will not be disrupted when the "old" CPC is removed

description.p: Ensure CTN will not be unexpectedly disrupted when the "old" CPC where the CF image resides is removed.

step.instructions:
Reassign STP roles, as needed.
For more information, see IBM White Paper 101833, Important Considerations for STP server role assignments (at http://www.ibm.com/support/techdocs/atsmastr.nsf/WebIndex/WP101833).

step.name: Step6
step.title: Place the CF to be shutdown in maintenance mode
step.description:
Place the CF to be shutdown in maintenance mode so that no new structures will be allocated on the CF.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Place the CF to be shutdown in maintenance mode so that no new structures will be allocated on the CF by issuing the following command:
SETXCF START,MAINTMODE,CFNAME=cfname
This command is sysplex scope and only needs to be entered on one system.

step.name: Step7
step.title: Move structures off the CF
step.description:
Move structures off the CF.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Use the following procedure to prepare for and then move structures off the CF using the REALLOCATE command:
Preview the results of REALLOCATE using the following command:
D XCF,REALLOCATE,TEST
Evaluate any exceptions in the results of the preview of REALLOCATE. If a severe problem is detected, remove cfname from MAINTMODE and address the problem. Then, go back to Step 5, "Place the CF to be upgraded in maintenance mode".
Issue the following command to have XCF assess and possibly relocate structures:
SETXCF START,REALLOCATE
XCF will seek to move the structures off the CF in MAINTMODE.
Determine whether any structures remain in the CF being removed from service by issuing the following command:
D XCF,CF,CFNAME=cfname
In the command output, look for structures remaining in the CF being removed. If structures remain in the CF being removed, skip to Step 7, "Manually rebuild any structures that remain in the CF".

step.name: Step8
step.title: Manually rebuild any structures that remain in the CF
step.description:
Manually rebuild any structures that remain in CF cfname.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Application-specific protocols may be needed to move structures.
For details about moving structures out of the CF, see Removing structures from a coupling facility for shutdown (https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSLTBW_2.2.0/com.ibm.zos.v2r2.ieaf100/remstr.htm) and Actions to remove a structure from a coupling facility (https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSLTBW_2.2.0/com.ibm.zos.v2r2.ieaf100/actrem.htm) in z/OS MVS Setting Up a Sysplex (https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSLTBW_2.2.0/com.ibm.zos.v2r2.ieaf100/toc.htm).
Issue the following commands to manually rebuild any structures that remain in the CF:
SETXCF START,REBUILD,STRNAME=strname,LOC=OTHER SETXCF STOP,REBUILD,DUPLEX,STRNAME=strname,KEEP=NEW|OLD
Verify that no structures remain on the coupling facility about to be upgraded:
D XCF,CF,CFNAME=cfname

step.name: Step9
step.title: VARY the paths to the CF offline

description.p: VARY the paths to the CF offline.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.

ol.li:
VARY the paths to the CF offline using the following command:
VARY PATH(CFNAME,xx,CFNAME,yy,etc),OFFLINE,UNCOND
You must issue the VARY command from all systems in the sysplex; path numbers may be different for each system. Taking the paths offline and then recycling is cleaner for z/OS to handle than not taking the paths offline. The hot unplug or TOGGLE is received as an “error” by z/OS.
To obtain the list of CHPIDs, issue D CF from each system. The list of CHPIDs is helpful when bringing the paths back online.
The VARY command is used rather than the CONFIG command because it is possible that use of the links by STP would cause the CONFIG command to be rejected. Using the VARY command affects only the logical path state for coupling facility communication and does not affect (nor is it affected by) the STP network; STP can still utilize the links to maintain the timing network.
When the paths are VARYd OFFLINE, the D CF,CFNAME=cfname command shows the paths as being logically offline, but physically online.

At this point, the paths to the CF will indicate logically OFFLINE. Re-verify that no structures in the CF and no systems have connectivity to CF using the following commands:
RO *ALL,D CF,CFNAME=cfname
Verify that no structures remain on the coupling facility about to be upgraded:
D XCF,CF,CFNAME=cfname

step.name: Step10
step.title: Shut down the CF
step.description:
Shut down the CF.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
From the Operating System Messages panel for the Coupling Facility on the Hardware Management Console (HMC), issue the SHUTDOWN command. The SHUTDOWN command is recommended to avoid the potential error of DEACTIVATING the coupling facility that has all of the structures allocated in it. The SHUTDOWN command will not complete if structures are present in the coupling facility.
The following scenario shows the message sequence for the SHUTDOWN command when structures are still allocated in the CF: => shutdown CF0090A Do you really want to shut down the Coupling Facility? (YES/NO) => yes CF0093A There are structures present in the CF. SHUTDOWN canceled.
After the SHUTDOWN command completes successfully, the CF LPAR will become “not operating.”
If structures are still allocated in the CF, verify that the correct CF was selected for SHUTDOWN. If the correct CF was selected, consider reviewing the structures still allocated in the CF and seek to move them out of the CF. At this point, the paths must be VARYd back ONLINE to allow structures to rebuild out of the CF. VARY the paths ONLINE and go back to Step 7, "Manually rebuild any structures that remain in the CF". If VARYing the paths ONLINE and moving the structures is not desired (that is, deleting the structures has been deemed acceptable), the CF image may be DEACTIVATEd.

step.name: Step12
step.title: Activate the CF partition
step.description:
Activate the CF partition.
See the Perform workflow tab for further information.
step.instructions: The CF must be activated to allow the system to connect and utilize the image.

step.name: Step13
step.title: Reassign STP roles, as needed.
step.description:
Reassign STP roles, as needed, to ensure that STP is in the desired configuration.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions: For more information, see IBM White Paper 101833, Important Considerations for STP server role assignments (at http://www.ibm.com/support/techdocs/atsmastr.nsf/WebIndex/WP101833).

step.name: Step14
step.title: Vary the paths online from all active z/OS images
step.description:
Vary the paths online from all active z/OS images.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Because there was no change to the CF definition in the CFRM policy, the same links and control unit are used to access the CF, the logical state of the paths will be OFFLINE. Thus, the paths need to be VARYd ONLINE from all of the z/OS images that remained active. Use the list of paths made in Step 8.
Use the following command to vary the paths online on each active z/OS image:
V PATH(cfname,xx,cfname,yy,etc),ONLINE

step.name: Step15
step.title: Activate the new CFRM Policy
step.description:
Activate the new CFRM policy with the definitions for the updated structure sizes from Step 2, "Create new CFRM policy" per CFSizer or SIZER output. Structure size changes will be pending after the new or modified policy is activated. Bypass this step, if no policy was created or modified in Step 2.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Issue the following command:
SETXCF START,POLICY,TYPE=CFRM,POLNAME=new_policyOr
SETXCF START,POLICY,TYPE=CFRM,POLNAME=mod_active_policy
To verify that the CFRM policy is activated, issue the following command:
D XCF,POLICY,TYPE=CFRM

step.name: Step16
step.title: Take the newly-defined CF out of MAINTMODE
step.description:
Take the newly-defined CF out of MAINTMODE.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.
step.instructions:
Take the newly-defined CF out of MAINTMODE to allow structure allocations in the new CF using the following command:
SETXCF STOP,MAINTMODE,CFNAME=cfname

step.name: Step17
step.title: Relocate structures to the desired CFs
step.description:
Relocate structures to the desired CFs.
See the Perform workflow tab for further instructions.

ol.li:
Issue the following command to relocate structures to the desired CFs:
SETXCF START,REALLOCATE
XCF will seek to resolve the pending policy changes.

To verify that all structures reside in the desired CFs, issue the following command and correct any errors noted by the report:
D XCF,REALLOCATE,REPORT

Double check that structures reside in the preferred CFs - Even if REALLOCATE processing completes without exceptions you still need to double check that structures are in the preferred CFs - XCF / XES places the structure in the most desirable CFs, which may not coincide with the order of the CFs in the PREFLIST or the desired CF site preference for duplexed structures. To verify that structures reside in the preferred CFs, review output from z/OS Health Check XCF_CF_STR_PREFLIST. Investigate structures that were not placed in the desired CF PREFLIST order, taking into account any CF site preferences for duplexed structures. Assess the reason for the structure placement and relocated structures to desired CFs, as needed.
Use the following SETXCF REBUILD commands, as necessary, to move structures:
SETXCF START,REBUILD,STRNAME=strname,LOC=OTHER SETXCF STOP,REBUILD,DUPLEX,STRNAME=strname,KEEP=NEW|OLD

step.name: Step18
step.title: IPL z/OS images that reside on the CPC that was PORd
step.description: IPL z/OS images that reside on the CPC that was PORd.
step.instructions: IPL z/OS images that reside on the CPC that was PORd.
